alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Somerset; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 11:32PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Mercer, south central Somerset, central Monmouth and southwestern Middlesex Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1132 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Windsor, or 10 miles east of Trenton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Princeton, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Cranbury, Allentown, Roosevelt, Rocky Hill, Princeton Meadows, Windsor, Kingston, East Freehold, Dayton, Plainsboro Center and Robertsville. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8A and 9. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 5 and 16. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 63 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
